reviews.text: Draught. Quite hazy almost muddy orange colour. Fair lacing. Sweet good frutiness in the aroma. The flavour is mildly sweet with a good frutiness and a soft bitterness.

Bottle. Light brown colour with bubblu short head. Aroma of toasted malts, some caramel and bit fruity. Clean nice flavour of caramel, toasted malts. Dryish aftertaste with just a touch of the sweet caramel. Short aftertaste. Pretty good for a "classic" beer style.

Can. Pours a clear golden colour with a  bubbly and creamy rather short lasting white head leaving a fair lacing. Aroma of bitterish hops, grains and some malt. The mouthfeel is a bit waterish. The flavour is mild with a soft pleasant bitterness, some grains and malt. A simple but not bad at all pale lager. Well lasting bitter finish.
